topic_65_2.value: Opera is an art form in which singers and musicians perform a play that combines words and music. It incorporates many of the elements of spoken theatre, such as acting, scenery, and costumes. Performances are typically given in an opera house and accompanied by an orchestra.

topic_65_3.value: The opera singer has worked hard to win the role in the new production. Her job is not just about singing. Acting, stage presence, and musical interpretation are all critical. But her pure, strong voice is certainly the star of the show.

topic_66_1.value: A painter must keep many elements in mind while completing a painting. She has to use solid elements of design, like strong composition and lighting. She has to execute the brush strokes with skill. Most importantly, the content of the painting should reveal a glimpse of the painter's soul.

topic_66_2.value: Long ago, painters were employed more as skilled artisans than as creative artists. However, prominent painters had the social status of scholars and members of the royal court. They signed their work, decided on its subject and imagery, and established a personal relationship with their patrons.

topic_66_3.value: As a painter, I learned to focus less on the actual scene and more on the painting itself. An artist's eye is not a camera lens that has to record everything within its field of vision. I found nature provides useful information, but more than is needed for a good painting.

topic_67_1.value: The eagle owl is an impressive bird. It has ear tufts that stick up like horns. Its large orange eyes are downright creepy, and look like they could pierce right through you. This owl hunts at night, flying swiftly and silently through the darkness.

topic_67_2.value: While some owl species have become endangered, others are thriving. The barred owl has spread well beyond its previous habitat. Early findings suggest that logging may have facilitated the barred owl's invasion.

topic_67_3.value: The owl landed on a thick branch and gripped it with her talons. She pressed her wings to her sides and settled down, half-closing an eye. She might have been a statue but for the glow of her eyes.

topic_68_1.value: It's unnerving to watch a polar bear stalk across floating sea ice. It's even worse when you are submerged in the frigid waters directly beneath the huge animal. Overhead, giant paws set down on the ice as the polar bear pursued its prey. As part of the film crew for a polar bear documentary, I spent months capturing these shots.

topic_68_2.value: Polar bears are one of the few animals that will attack people for reasons other than fear or confusion. They may attack out of hunger because they live in a food- scarce environment. They will sneak up on people slowly, careful to conserve their energy.

topic_68_3.value: The seal is an important part of the polar bear's diet. When hunting, they will wait by a seal's breathing hole, or stalk seals that are basking on the ice. The polar bear will crawl quietly forward and freeze in place when the seal looks around.

topic_69_1.value: The medieval castle was not a structure built primarily for defense. Its purpose was to dominate its surroundings. A castle could easily control lands within a day's walk. During times of attack, peasants, livestock, and property could be brought inside the castle's walls for protection.

topic_69_2.value: Spectacular castles in dramatic locations provide a record of the stormy history of many regions. Today, they stand atop rocky cliffs overlooking beautiful landscapes and quaint villages. In the past, they were home to battles, plots and intrigue.

topic_69_3.value: Upon leaving the train station we saw our hotel looming above: a magnificent castle built on a cliff. The thick outside walls sheltered an inner courtyard hundreds of feet above the river. Our tower rooms had an incredible but slightly scary view.

topic_70_1.value: After climbing fifty feet up the side of the pyramid, the man gestured me into a small black entranceway. This led into the chamber at the pyramid's center. I followed him down the steep, dark, narrow passage. The smell inside the pyramid was chalky and the air was thick.

topic_70_2.value: More than just the tomb of the king, pyramids represented the pride of the nation. The care that the pyramid builders took in their craft is evident. The stones covering the pyramid were precisely fitted together and polished until the structure gleamed.

topic_70_3.value: Architects are still working to solve the mysteries of how pyramids were constructed. Some think ramps were built inside the pyramid's walls to raise stone blocks. Others speculate that ramps zigzagged up the exterior walls of the pyramid.

topic_71_1.value: Even beginner rock climbing takes courage and strength. Climbers who are learning the sport can try scrambling on large boulders. Once they're comfortable with that, they can begin using ropes to safely climb vertical rock faces.

topic_71_2.value: All of the boys on the trip were new to rock climbing. Many were afraid of heights. Having someone else check their knots and harnesses helped them calm down. The adults set up climbing routes appropriate for beginners.

topic_71_3.value: Free-climbing is one particular style of rock climbing. The climber relies solely on her skill and physical strength to ascend a rock face. Rope and bolts are the only equipment used. They are meant only to stop the climber if she falls.

topic_72_1.value: I hesitantly skied down the steep trail that my buddies convinced me to try. I made a bad turn and I found myself tumbling down. I finally came to a stop at a flat part of the slope. My skis were nowhere to be found and my poles were lodged in a snow drift up the hill.

topic_72_2.value: A major strength of professional skiers is how they use ski poles. Proper use of ski poles improves their balance and adds flair to their skiing. It minimizes the need for upper body movements to regain lost balance while skiing.

topic_72_3.value: TNew ski designs and stiffer boots let skiers turn more quickly. But faster and tighter turns increase the twisting force on the legs. This has led to more injuries, particularly to ligaments in the skier's knee.
